content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 5 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 0. f of x is 13. Column 2. x is 2. f of x is 5. Column 3. x is 5. f of x is 17. Column 4. x is 7. f of x is 28. Column 5. x is 11. f of x is 41." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em " equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>11</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>13</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>17</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>28</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>41</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Selected values of a differentiable function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above. What is the fewest possible number of values of <math alttext="c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 11, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext>11</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> for which the Mean Value Theorem guarantees that <math alttext="f prime of c, equals 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
